content:
Jes Stevens is a community development specialist with Washington University Medical Center Redevelopment Corporation (WUMCRC). He is passionate working side by side with residents and stakeholders in an effort to create sustainable communities where everyone can live work and play.
He is committed to using quantitative data to help guide decision making and implementation in the community planning process. Jes currently leads a team of interns and works alongside other project managers, residents, and other community development specialists on a variety of different projects.
summary: Jes Stevens is a community development specialist with Washington University Medical Center Redevelopment Corporation (WUMCRC). He is passionate working side by side with residents and stakeholders in an effort to create sustainable communities where everyone can live work and play.

content: The West End South Community Improvement District is a economic development tool that would generate additional revenue for the proposed geographic region. Jes Stevens is providing technical assistance to the neighborhood residents and stakeholders who are interested in implementing the proposed district. You can find out more about the proposed district on their website.
summary: The West End South Community Improvement District is a proposed economic development district in the City of St. Louis.
title: West End South Community Improvement District

content: In it’s original form the St. Louis Metropolitan Police Department (SLMPD) crime data is downloadable as a csv file. The data itself is also unorganized and challenging to work with. In an effort to simplify & reduce the time it takes to compile our reports, r, tidyverse, and compstatr are all packages that streamline and help the process. This project utilizes these resources for accessing and cleaning the data, with the eventual goal of automating a monthly report for neighborhoods that fall within the service area of. This project is being done through R, and RStudio. For updates & replication visit the source code here
summary: This project utilizes `compstatr`, to quicky clean, organize, and analyze crime data in the city of St. Louis, with the eventual goal of automating a monthly crime report.
title: Crime Mapping
